message: Ahh, ok
which is fine i guess we just havent done it yet

Apologies if this has come up already: couldn't find it on search. I keep finding myself wanting to click anywhere on a row when it changes to a darker color on rollover. However, I can only click on the header to get to the group/topic.
I'm sorry, I don't quite understand
I'll check it out on my machine now to see if it replicates
I can imagine. Would be nice if it were there but not the end of the world if not :-)
like in the topics list for a group?

For example on the 'your groups' page. When I rollover a row that contains Group Name, Created By, etc, the whole row turns a darker blue. I'd like to be able to click anywhere on that row to jump to the group (i.e. not just on the group title itself)
It's just something I noticed myself trying to do - not sure if it fits in with best practice etc
i get the rollover effect in safari but not firefox
and in chrome
I think there was some trickiness with having a click target within a click target?  @etmaguire would know better
No I totally see what you're saying @spencer
/cc @etmaguire
oh, weird
but i get grey, not dark blue
(I'm not the right person to respond to this, ha)
sorry yes, it's gray. Will start taking notes before giving feedback!
i'm going to note the non-rollover in ff as a separate bug
i think we will do this just need to figure out the best way to accomplish it
i don think the correct way is to just wrap everything with an anchor tag
that leaves js
anyone have an example of this so i can dissect it.. or possibly know the *best practice* for such a thing
@spencer ah, okay, just wanted to double-check
i think twitter adds a click event to a div "stream-item" that wraps everything which is prob what we'll end up doing
@etmaguire best practice is to attach an event handler to the root node of something (like that LI) and then intercept all clicks to it, sussing out what to do from the event that's passed in.
http://www.cherny.com/webdev/70/javascript-event-delegation-and-event-hanlders
http://net.tutsplus.com/tutorials/javascript-ajax/quick-tip-javascript-event-delegation-in-4-minutes/
$('li.topic-title').click(function (e) { console.debug(e) })    then you're looking for e.target, I believe.
@justinlilly thanks..I figured something to this effect would be the best way.. will prob implement this soon
awesome. There is also a jquery .delegate() function which may be more helpful. Last did that 2 years ago, so things are too fuzzy now.
@spencer so youre not the first person that has asked for this
